title: Strategy Development for Linking School Autonomy and Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of educational policies and organizational management, with school operational experience
context.additional_context: Targeting corporate science education program managers and policymakers.

learning_goals: Students can distinguish types of school autonomy (internal, cultural, structural) and apply them to real-world cases.
Students can design tools to evaluate autonomy levels from the perspectives of diverse stakeholders (teachers, students, parents, etc.).
Students can develop a reconceptualized framework to analyze the causal relationship between school autonomy and learning outcomes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
